body_html:
@weiyangfb Thank you for your kind reply!

My question is, How does the *.rst files are generated?

I've found these files, but these *_docs.py files is for addingdocString to the corresponding class and methods in *.rst, rather than controlling the whole content in the *.rst files.

For short, I know the *.rst files could generate the htmls in PyTorch repo. But how does these *.rst files are generated? For my knowledge, these rst files could be generated by sphinx-apidoc -o command or by being written by hand.

Some content in html files (or their corresponding *.rst files) do NOT exist in any of these *_docs.py files or other *.py files.

For an example:
Just like I mentioned above, (please see here), the docString below the .. class:: Tensor() in the tensors.rst (which could be used to generate html, like you said) could not be found in any *.py file.

body:
@weiyangfb Thank you for your kind reply!

My question is, **How does the `*.rst` files are generated?**

I've found these files, but these `*_docs.py` files is for adding`docString` to the corresponding class and methods in `*.rst`, rather than controlling the whole content in the `*.rst` files.

For short, I know the `*.rst` files could generate the htmls in `PyTorch` repo. But how does these `*.rst` files are generated? For my knowledge, these `rst` files could be generated by `sphinx-apidoc -o` command or by being written by hand.  

Some content in html files (or their corresponding `*.rst` files) do NOT exist in any of these `*_docs.py` files or other `*.py` files. 

For an example:
Just like I mentioned above, (please see [here](https://pytorch.org/docs/stable/tensors.html)), the docString below the `.. class:: Tensor()` in the `tensors.rst` (which could be used to generate html, like you said) could not be found in any `*.py` file.
